description: See how Kenyon compares to more than 2,000 American colleges.
title: Economic diversity and student outcomes at Kenyon
title_page: Economic diversity and student outcomes at Kenyon - The New York Times
text:
Gambier, Ohio
The median family income of a student from Kenyon is $213,500, and 75% come from the top 20 percent. Less than 1% of students at Kenyon came from a poor family but became a rich adult.
A new study, based on millions of anonymous tax records, shows that some colleges are even more economically segregated than previously understood, while others are associated with income mobility.
Below, estimates of how Kenyon compares with its peer schools in economic diversity and student outcomes.
